title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the demand curve is elastic between $80 and $70 and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue is positive; or use numbers to explain that total revenue is rising in that price range, the percentage change in quantity is greater than the percentage change in price, or the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1.

The response states that the demand curve is elastic between $80 and $70 and explains that the marginal revenue is positive; or uses numbers to explain that total revenue is rising in that price range, the percentage change in quantity is greater than the percentage change in price, or the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm would produce 40 units of output at the allocatively efficient price and/or does not explain that at that quantity the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers (where marginal cost crosses the demand curve).

The response states that the firm would produce 40 units of output at the allocatively efficient price and explains that at that quantity the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers (where marginal cost crosses the demand curve).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm would produce 50 units of output to maximize total revenue and/or does not explain that at that quantity the marginal revenue is equal to zero, or use numbers to explain that total revenue is maximized at that quantity of output.

The response states that the firm would produce 50 units of output to maximize total revenue and explains that at that quantity the marginal revenue is equal to zero, or uses numbers to explain that total revenue is maximized at that quantity of output.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 30 units and/or does not explain that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost, or explain that when marginal revenue is higher than marginal cost the firm should increase production because each additional sale increases the firm’s profit and when marginal cost is higher than marginal revenue the firm should decrease production because it costs more to produce the last unit than what the firm will earn from it.

The response identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 30 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost, or explains that when marginal revenue is higher than marginal cost the firm should increase production because each additional sale increases the firm’s profit and when marginal cost is higher than marginal revenue the firm should decrease production because it costs more to produce the last unit than what the firm will earn from it.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
